page.title: 07TIDES AND DANGERS AT OVERY
page.content: The tides and mudholes at Burnham Overy Creek are very dangerous because the tides come in very quickly. Many holiday makers get stranded on the marshes. If you are stuck in a mudhole and the tide comes in you would drown. As well as the holes there is quick-sand. A little child who was only five year's old was drowned in one of the holes. The quick-sand just looks like ordinary mud, if you step on it you may sink instantly so you have to take care in Burnham Overy Creek. Another danger was the floods in 1953. There are lots of little passages running through and round the marshes and they are dangerous because the strong current can take you out to sea.
